intro: Desmonema scytophyllum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flax, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features linear, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Desmonema scytophyllum is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine.
